Package com.github.actionfx.core

Class ActionFX

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.actionfx.core.ActionFX
  • public class ActionFX
extends java.lang.Object
    Central handler for working with ActionFX. It provides routines to get views and controllers.

    As ActionFX uses an internal bean container with dependency injection support, it is recommended to wire all controllers with @Inject instead of accessing them through this class (please note that there is also support of Spring's bean container through ActionFX's actionfx-spring-boot module).

    Using ActionFX:

    Before using this class, it needs to be setup in the main() or Application.init() method for the specific application.

    Expample: 

     ActionFX actionFX = ActionFX.builder().configurationClass(SampleApp.class).build();
    After the setup, an instance of this class is retrieved throughout the application via: 
     ActionFX instance = ActionFX.getInstance();
    After the ActionFX instance is built, a component scan can be performed: 
     ActionFX.getInstance().scanForActionFXComponents();
    This will populate ActionFX internal bean container and makes controller and views available for usage. Please note, that this step is not required, if you use Spring Boot and included module afx-spring-boot in your application classpath. The afx-spring-boot provides auto-configuration and scans for ActionFX components with its Spring bean container during start-up.

    In case you need access to the ActionFX instance in a controller, you can alternatively inject the ActionFX instance via Inject. This might be helpful for unit testing your controller independently of a setup ActionFX instance (you can use e.g. Mockito to mock the ActionFX instance for unit-testing). 

     @AFXController(viewId="mainView", fxml="some.fxml">
 public class MainController {

 @Inject
 private ActionFX actionFX;

 }
    Author:
    koster

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static ActionFX.ActionFXBuilder builder()
        Creates a builder that is used for setting up the application-specific instance of ActionFX.
        Returns:
        the ActionFX builder instance that is used to setup the configuration

      • getInstance

        public static ActionFX getInstance()
        Gets an instance of ActionFX. Before calling this method, you need to setup your application-specific configuration that ActionFX shall handle by using the builder() method, returning an instance of ActionFX.ActionFXBuilder.
        Returns:
        the built ActionFX instance

      • isConfigured

        public static boolean isConfigured()
        Returns true, in case the ActionFX instance is available and the state is either ActionFX.ActionFXState.INITIALIZED or ActionFX.ActionFXState.CONFIGURED , false, if the instance is not yet setup or the state is ActionFX.ActionFXState.UNINITIALIZED.
        Returns:
        true, in case the ActionFX instance is properly available and setup for use, false otherwise

      • isInitialized

        public static boolean isInitialized()
        Returns true, in case the ActionFX instance is available and the state is ActionFX.ActionFXState.INITIALIZED , false, if the instance is not yet setup or the state is ActionFX.ActionFXState.UNINITIALIZED or ActionFX.ActionFXState.CONFIGURED
        Returns:
        true, in case the ActionFX instance is properly available and initialized, false otherwise

      • scanForActionFXComponents

        public void scanForActionFXComponents()
        Scans for ActionFX components, depending on the configured getScanPackage().

        This method requires that the JavaFX thread is up-and-running, as certain components (e.g. WebView) can only be instantiated within the JavaFX thread.

      • addController

        public void addController​(java.lang.Class<?> controllerClass)
        Adds a new controller to ActionFX' internal bean container. It is expected that the controller class is annotated by AFXController.

        Please prefer scanning for controller classes via scanForActionFXComponents() and a set scanPackage in the internal ActionFX.ActionFXBuilder.

        Additionally, please keep in mind that you need to take care for controller dependencies on your own, i.e. if you inject a controller B into controller A, you need to add the controller class for B before you add the controller class for A.

        Parameters:
        controllerClass - the controller bean class

      • getView

        public View getView​(java.lang.String viewId)
        Gets the view by the supplied viewId.
        Parameters:
        viewId - the view ID
        Returns:
        the view instance. If the viewId does not exists, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

      • getBean

        public <T> T getBean​(java.lang.Class<T> beanClass)
        Gets the controller defined by the supplied controllerClass.
        Parameters:
        beanClass - the bean class for that an instance shall be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the retrieved controller instance.If the controllerClass does not exists, null is returned.

      • getControllerResourceBundle

        public java.util.ResourceBundle getControllerResourceBundle​(java.lang.String controllerId)
        Gets the ResourceBundle that is used internationalization of the view associated with the controller identified by controllerId.

        The locale is retrieved from the getObservableLocale() that has been configured with this instance of ActionFX.

        Parameters:
        controllerId - the ID of the controller
        Returns:
        the resource bundle, or null, in case there is no resource bundle associated with the given controller

      • getControllerResourceBundle

        The locale is retrieved from the getObservableLocale() that has been configured with this instance of ActionFX.

        Parameters:
        controllerClass - the controller class
        Returns:
        the resource bundle, or null, in case there is no resource bundle associated with the given controller

      • dockNestedView

        public void dockNestedView​(java.lang.String nestedViewId)
        Performs an dock operation for a nested view injected into a controller via AFXNestedView, in case the nested view is undocked.
        Parameters:
        nestedViewId - the view ID of the nested view (must be injected into a view via AFXNestedView).

      • undockNestedView

        public void undockNestedView​(java.lang.String nestedViewId)
        Performs an undock operation for a nested view injected into a controller via AFXNestedView, in case the nested view is docked.
        Parameters:
        nestedViewId - the view ID of the nested view (must be injected into a view via AFXNestedView).

      • isNestedViewDocked

        public boolean isNestedViewDocked​(java.lang.String nestedViewId)
        Determines whether the nested view identfied by nestedViewId is currently docked into a parent scenegraph.
        Parameters:
        nestedViewId - the view ID of the nested view (must be injected into a view via AFXNestedView).
        Returns:
        true, if the given nested view is currently docked into the parent scene graph, false, if the view is displayed undocked in its own stage.

        Returns:

        public java.lang.String showTextInputDialog​(java.lang.String title,
                                            java.lang.String headerText,
                                            java.lang.String contentText)
        Displays a modal TextInputDialog that lets the user enter a single string value.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the input dialog
        headerText - a header text to be displayed inside the dialogue
        contentText - a content text displayed in front of the input text field
        Returns:
        the entered string value, or null, if no value has been entered.

      • showTextInputDialog

        public java.lang.String showTextInputDialog​(java.lang.String title,
                                            java.lang.String headerText,
                                            java.lang.String contentText,
                                            java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Displays a modal TextInputDialog that lets the user enter a single string value. A default text is already pre-set.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the input dialog
        headerText - a header text to be displayed inside the dialogue
        contentText - a content text displayed in front of the input text field
        defaultValue - the pre-set default text
        Returns:
        the entered string value, or null, if no value has been entered.

      • publishEvent

        public void publishEvent​(java.lang.Object event)
        Publishes the given event to all methods that are annotated by AFXSubscribe and which are listening to the type of event.

        In case the annotated method has a method argument that is of the same type than event, then the event is used as method argument to that method.

        Please note that methods annotated by AFXSubscribe can also have additional method argument, that are e.g. annotated by AFXControlValue.

        Parameters:
        event - the event to publish

      • getScanPackage

        public java.lang.String getScanPackage()
        The package name with dot-notation "." that shall be scanned for ActionFX components.
        Returns:
        this builder

      • getBeanContainer

        public BeanContainerFacade getBeanContainer()
        Grants access to the bean container. Mainly for testing purposes.
        Returns:
        the underlying bean container implementation

      • getEnhancementStrategy

        public ActionFXEnhancer.EnhancementStrategy getEnhancementStrategy()

        Returns:

      • getObservableLocale

        public javafx.beans.value.ObservableValue<java.util.Locale> getObservableLocale()

        Returns:

      • setPrimaryStage

        public void setPrimaryStage​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Users can set the primary stage here so that it is available throughout the application.
        Parameters:
        primaryStage - the primary stage

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets ActionFX to its initial state. Can be used in unit test. Use this method in productive code only when you know exactly what you are doing.
